meanings.definition: An organized whole that is perceived as more than the sum of its parts.
meanings.sent1: The gestalts of the puzzle pieces coming together created a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent2: When looking at the painting, she admired the gestalts of colors blending seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The gestalts of the jumbled words on the page made her laugh at the silly sentence they formed.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the gestalts of sunlight filtering through the leaves painted a magical scene.
meanings.sent5: The gestalts of flavors in the dish danced on her taste buds, creating a symphony of deliciousness.

meanings.definition: A configuration or pattern of elements so unified as a whole that it cannot be described merely as a sum of its parts.
meanings.sent1: The gestalts of the intricate design left everyone in awe of its beauty.
meanings.sent2: The architect carefully considered the gestalts of the building to ensure harmony in its structure.
meanings.sent3: The gestalts of the mismatched socks peeking out of his shoes made him chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, breaking the gestalts of silence that hung heavy in the air.
meanings.sent5: The gestalts of emotions swirling within her were reflected in her eyes, revealing a storm of feelings.
